enum IPDR_compareDSN_t compareDSN (  IPDR_DSN_TYPE  d1,
IPDR_DSN_TYPE  d2
) 
 

Compare two DSNs, taking into account wrap-around

Parameters:
d1 the first DSN
d2 the second DSN
Returns:
'>', '=', '<', '?' for d1 > d2, d1 == d2, d1 < d2, not comparable 
00053 {
00054     enum IPDR_compareDSN_t result = IPDR_compareDSN_unknown;
00055 
00056 #if 1
00057     /* unsigned arithmetic */
00058 
00059     if (d1 == d2) {
00060         result = IPDR_compareDSN_equal;
00061     } else {
00062         IPDR_DSN_TYPE diff1 = d1 - d2;
00063         IPDR_DSN_TYPE diff2 = d2 - d1;
00064         IPDR_DSN_TYPE diff = (diff1 <= diff2) ? diff1 : diff2;
00065         if (diff <= IPDR_VALID_DSN_WINDOW) {
00066             if ((d1 + diff) == d2) {
00067                 result = IPDR_compareDSN_less;
00068             } else if ((d2 + diff) == d1) {
00069                 result = IPDR_compareDSN_greater;
00070             } /* else: shouldn't happen */
00071         }
00072     }
00073 #else
00074     /* signed arithmetic */
00075     if (d1 == d2) {
00076         result = IPDR_compareDSN_equal;
00077     } else if (abs(d1 - d2) <= IPDR_VALID_DSN_WINDOW) {
00078         result = (d1 > d2) ? IPDR_compareDSN_greater : IPDR_compareDSN_less;
00079     } else if ((IPDR_MAX_DSN - d2) + (d1 - IPDR_INITIAL_DSN) <= IPDR_VALID_DSN_WINDOW) {
00080         result = (d2 > d1) ? IPDR_compareDSN_greater : IPDR_compareDSN_less;
00081     } else if ((IPDR_MAX_DSN - d1) + (d2 - IPDR_INITIAL_DSN) <= IPDR_VALID_DSN_WINDOW) {
00082         result = (d2 > d1) ? IPDR_compareDSN_greater : IPDR_compareDSN_less;
00083     }
00084 #endif
00085 
00086     return result;
00087 }

int Util_Pad32 (  unsigned int  Size  ) 
 

Pad a number to the closest 32 bit boundary

Parameters:
Size number to pad
Returns:
Padded number 
00198 {
00199     if (Size % 4 == 0)
00200         return Size;
00201     return Size + 4 - (Size % 4);
00202 }

00122                                               NULL, (void **) Target);

IPDR_Status Util_StrDupAndReplace (  IPDR_PlatformServices *  PS,
const char *  Source,
char **  Target
) 
 

Object_Release + StrDup

Parameters:
PS platform services
Source source string
Target target string (replaced)
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00150 {
00151     /* The following must be done in the right order. If we first
00152        release *Target and then StrDup onto it, we could have a
00153        problem if Source happens to be the same as *Target. What we
00154        should do is first do a StrDup, then release *Target and
00155        finally slap the StrDup'ed thing into *Target.
00156     */
00157 
00158     char *newTargetObj;
00159     IPDR_Status rc;
00160 
00161     if (Source == *Target) {
00162         /* Don't do anything because the source is already there ...
00163            we do this test now for efficiency and to avoid repeated
00164            memory allocation/deallocation (below). */
00165         return IPDR_OK;
00166     }
00167 
00168     if (Source == NULL) {
00169         newTargetObj = NULL;
00170         rc = IPDR_OK;
00171     } else {
00172 #ifdef DEBUG_MEMORY
00173         rc =Util_dm_StrDup(PS, Source, &newTargetObj, FileName, LineNum);
00174 #else
00175         rc =Util_StrDup(PS, Source, &newTargetObj);
00176 #endif
00177     }
00178 
00179 #ifdef DEBUG_MEMORY
00180     (void)Object_dm_Release(PS, *Target, FileName, LineNum);
00181 #else
00182     (void)Object_Release(PS, *Target);
00183 #endif
00184 
00185     *Target = newTargetObj;
00186 
00187     return rc;
00188 }
